result.execSummary:
The defendant April A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant April A Jones in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:18 AM. Jones has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Jones understands charges and penalties, does not want an attorney, recess to fill out waiver of counsel form (9:19 AM). Recalled at 9:27 AM. Court has waiver of right to counsel form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to counsel, finds she is competent to represent herself and will allow her to do so. Jones pleads G. Recess to fill out plea questionnaire (9:35 AM). Recalled at 9:42 AM. Jones pleads G. Courts has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has sent notification to the victim with no response but do know that the restitution amount is $110.00 plus $11 in VW surcharge for a total of $121.00, recommends 1 year probation, court costs and restitution only. Jones makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: costs - paid thru probation, restitution of $110.00 plus VW surcharge of $11.00 - apply bond posted - remainder due thru probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, AODA and follow thru, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, give DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
